message_1: What happens in a single replacement reaction when iron is added to a copper sulfate solution? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction that occurs and identify the product formed.
message_2:
In a single replacement reaction, iron (Fe) will replace copper (Cu) in the copper sulfate (CuSO₄) solution, forming iron sulfate (FeSO₄) and copper (Cu) as products. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

Fe (s) + CuSO₄ (aq) → FeSO₄ (aq) + Cu (s)

The products formed are iron sulfate (FeSO₄) in aqueous solution and solid copper (Cu).
